text: in the Middle East older people would
tell you about a time when it was
possible to have breakfast in Beirut's
lunch in Damascus and dinner in bandar
but alas that was in the past
100 years ago colonial powers signed the
sykes-picot agreement this established
borders ending the era of free travel
across the Levant so here's my idea the
mega linear city how can we make cities
along the east Mediterranean coast more
socially and economically connected
Europe stunning imagine this hmm a fast
rail network that extends from Turkey to
Egypt and back because you know the
trains have to combine cutting down
travel times and costs across the region
the idea is to transform the region from
poorly connected cities to an integrated
urban network think of it as a mega and
linear city this may sound far-fetched
but is not entirely inconceivable this
development has already started in
Lebanon almost half of the coast is now
one continuous urban stripped from
stallion can be an inspiration for what
is possible
like the possibility of having breakfast
in Alexandria lunch in Beirut and dinner
in Antalya
